subject: Re: Changing junit.framework.Assert to instance methods
msgSnippet: Shane, I thank you very much for putting together JFunc. However, I am still not convinced that JUnit should not be changed, so I don t have two versions of
messageBody:
Shane,

I thank you very much for putting together JFunc. However, I am still
not convinced that JUnit should not be changed, so I don't have two
versions of Assert in my code. Ideally JUnit "extensions" should
not "replace" core classes.

Regards,

David

--- In junit@y..., Shane Celis <shane@t...> wrote:
> David,
>
> In your prior email you stated that your tests "lean more towards
being
> functional tests." So I'm curious as to why you don't think the
> following is adequately addressed by JFunc?
